Advocacy & Planning Intergenerational Play Playground Maintenance Playground Supervision Power of Urban Play Safety Surfacing Words on Play FUNDING FIND YOUR Funding IMPACT Parks Find the Funds You Need Budgeting for a Playground Impact Parks ® Playground Funding Guide PURCHASING SUBMIT Contracts BUY WITH Omnia Partners Purchasing Assistance Apply for Credit Contract Submission OMNIA Partners Account 800-235-2440 Find a Rep Get a Catalog About us Get a Quote Contact Us Request info 0 Search Search Search Submenu About GameTime Committed to building communities through play and recreation since 1929 We’re Play Innovators, Play Experts and Play Researchers. GameTime brings play and recreation to people of all ages and abilities. Our local, experienced, and trusted team deploys research-based programs and education to deliver the most tailored play and recreation environments in the world. Since 1929 Our History of Enriching Childhood Through Play From the beginning, GameTime has demonstrated our passion for play with fun and innovative products that bring people together around recreation. Check out some of the key moments in our history. 1929 - Founded in Litchfield, Michigan 1975 - Introduced the first line of custom playground equipment 1979 - Moved to Fort Payne, Alabama 1982 - Introduced Durascape, the first metal composite play systems 1993 - PowerScape play systems are introduced 2011 - Making trails more playful with PlayTrails 2014 - Expression Swing changes the way children and parents play 2015 - Expanding outdoor fitness to all generations with Challenge Course 2020 - GameTime's custom play division becomes Landmark Design 2022 - GameTime introduces the first inclusive playground net - GT Wave Local Play Experts GameTime representatives and certified installers live, work, and play in your neighborhood. We provide turnkey, personal service throughout all phases of your play and recreation projects to ensure your playground, fitness park, Challenge Course, or one-of-a-kind custom play space is a community centerpiece. FIND A LOCAL REP Play Researchers As a PlayCore company, GameTime leverages the deep knowlege of the PlayCore Research Institute. The Institute is comprised of leading experts, universities, and research centers who work with PlayCore to investigate, discover, and communicate information and outcomes in scholarly works and outreach workshops. This research drives our product development and playspace design. LEARN MORE Green by Design Responsible play environments begin with a commitment to our environment. Environmental sustainability is our commitment to the children, families, and communities we serve today– and to many generations to come. That’s why our approach to sustainability encompasses every aspect of our company– from the way we manufacture our products, to how we do business. LEARN MORE The Industry’s Best Warranty Our products are constructed of durable, recyclable materials that are designed to last decades, not years. Each play system, fitness product, and freestanding activity is backed one of the industry’s leading warranties, and we offer a high level of customer service long after the project is completed. Our guarantee to you goes beyond replacement hardware and touch-up paint- our guarantee is to be a trusted partner in outdoor play and recreation for years to come. LEARN MORE GameTime Certifications Industry standards set a minimum level that playground manufacturers must meet. We meet or exceed those standards, because we understand that the ultimate playground offers peace of mind as well as thrills. After all, we’re parents too. LEARN MORE News from GameTime Check out the latest news and information from our headquarters in Fort Payne, Alabama. Read All News June 19, 2025 GameTime Q1 Product Recap: Strides in Intergenerational Play The first few months of 2025 have been filled with bold and exciting new products! From towering rope climbers to playfully themed early childhood products, 2025 is shaping up to be a year filled with new ways to make every playground more memorable, inspiring, and fun for everyone. Let’s take a look at the new products people are excited about! Aventus Collection and Inclusive Play Following the success of the Aventus Tower, we introduced the expanded Aventus collection , offering a variety of climbers and entryway options to enhance your Aventus designs. One of the foundational principles of Aventus is to create “Adventure for all of us” and offer new ways to include everyone in the fun. Everybody Plays ® Slide and Go A great addition to Aventus play systems is the EveryBody Plays Slide and Go . When you add this innovative slide to your playground design, you create more accessible opportunities. This slide allows children using mobility devices to comfortably transfer from the Read Article April 10, 2025 New Shelter Options: Introducing Salora Shelters by GameTime At GameTime, we’re always finding new ways to bring communities together through thoughtfully designed outdoor spaces. That’s why we’re excited to introduce Salora park and playground shelters - a new line of recreational shelters that blend timeless design with modern performance. With Salora shelters, it’s easier than ever to create inviting, functional spaces where people can gather, connect, and enjoy the outdoors. Why Are Park and Playground Shelters Important? Park shelters enrich outdoor experiences by creating spaces where people can rest, reflect, and reconnect. Whether hosting large community events or celebrating a child’s birthday, shelters offer a welcoming gathering place for every occasion. They also provide protection from the elements, encouraging people to stay outside, explore, and enjoy nature even longer. What Are Salora Shelters? Salora shelters are designed to provide shade, comfort, and style to parks, playgrounds, and outdoor recreation spaces. These structures Read Article March 13, 2025 How to Design a School Playground This year, the American Academy of Pediatrics reaffirmed their position that recess is essential for childhood development. Along with the many physical benefits associated with recess, the school playground is where social skills are learned, executive function improves, and children develop a sense of self. That’s a lot of responsibility for a school playground! Designing a school playground requires thoughtful planning to create a space where children can play, learn, and grow. For many children, school playgrounds are their primary place for outdoor play, providing essential opportunities to stay active, socialize, and unwind after a long day in the classroom. Read on to learn some of the ways you can design a school playground to support childhood development, encourage healthy habits, and foster a sense of community and connection for all students. Encourage Physical Activity on the School Playground with Play On!® Play On! is a physical education program developed by our parent Read Article Get a Quote for Customer Name Customer Email Phone Number Comment Submit Color Wizard™ Wield your wand and explore your options with our Color Wizard™ TRY NOW! Subscribe Sign up to receive the latest news and special offers from GameTime. SUBSCRIBE Follow Look for us on social media for updates and inspiration. linkedin youtube facebook (800) 235-2440 EMAIL GAMETIME PROUD PARTNER OF COMMUNITY CHAMPIONS SINCE 1929. We partner with you to create fun, innovative, and active outdoor spaces for a happier today and a healthier tomorrow. 150 PlayCore Drive SE Fort Payne, Alabama 35967 About Us Accessibility Statement Certifications Find a Rep Green by Design Installer Network Our Story Partnerships Play Research Products Amenities Fitness Playgrounds New Sale Resources Blog Catalogs Contact Credit/Financing Customer Survey Funding Privacy Policy Warranties FIND MY REPRESENTATIVE With play experts in over 30 countries on six continents, we provide sales and service where you live, work, and play. Wherever you are, we’re local! FIND A REPRESENTATIVE REQUEST A CATALOG View our selection of playground equipment, outdoor fitness products, and custom play space catalogs, and request a copy today. GameTime at One Daytona targets early summer opening News Sports Entertainment Opinion Advertise Obituaries eNewspaper Legals BRIEFS GameTime at One Daytona targets early summer opening Interior buildout finally underway for family entertainment center across from Speedway Clayton Park clayton.park@news-jrnl.com DAYTONA BEACH — To casual observers, construction of the long-awaited GameTime family entertainment center at One Daytona appears to have stalled. While much of the building remains hidden from view behind a temporary construction barricade adorned with images of bowling, a video game arcade and restaurant/sports bar, glimpses of the interior reveal a still bare concrete floor and unfinished interior. The project still seems a long way from being game-time ready, even though it was announced in late 2016 and was originally supposed to have opened this past fall. Not so, according to GameTime CEO Michael Abecassis, who says the 35,000-square-foot center is on track to open in a few months. "We expect to be open for summer as kids get out of school," Abecassis said in a phone interview on Thursday. Looking for a free mini puzzle? Play the USA TODAY Quick Cross now. Abecassis said his company recently began interior buildout after One Daytona's developer, International Speedway Corp., completed construction of the 35,000-square-foot standalone building's exterior. He attributed the need to delay the opening to "the process of going from raw dirt to a finished process, which is a large undertaking." "We're already well underway on the interior," he added. The South Florida-based chain will soon have competition: a Dave & Buster's family entertainment center is set to open this fall just two miles away at Tomoka Town Center, across from Tanger Outlets. Jeff Preston, executive vice president of North American Development Group, which is developing a 450,000-square-foot "power lifestyle" retail complex at Tomoka Town Center did not know the date for when Dave & Buster's will open, but wrote in a text message that, "We expect the vast majority of tenants to be open in the fall. All have different opening dates." A spokesperson for the Dallas, Texas-based Dave & Buster's Entertainment Inc. did not respond to a request for comment. The public company (NASDAQ: PLAY) in its most recent quarterly earnings report in December stated: "In fiscal 2018, we plan to open a total of 14 to 15 new stores. ... These openings will skew toward the large store format and existing markets for our brand." The closest Dave & Buster's locations currently are in Orlando and Jacksonville. The chain describes itself as an operator of arcade/restaurants "centered around playing games and watching live sports and other televised events." Some of its older locations also include bowling. GameTime is a South Florida-based chain whose headquarters is in Davie. It has locations in Fort Myers, Miami, Tampa, Panama City and Sebring and is set to open a location in Ocoee, possibly as soon as next week, Abecassis said. The Daytona Beach location will be next up and will include more than 60 flat-screen televisions, more than 100 new and retro classic arcade games, prize machines, mini bowling, 12 full lanes of bowling and other attractions, as well as a full liquor bar and full-service restaurant, according to GameTime's website. The company last month posted job openings online for a general manager, game floor operations manager, restaurant manager, bar manager and assistant kitchen manager. Abecassis said his company has already filled some management positions for the Daytona Beach location. He said the location is expected to employ 160-180 workers when it opens, adding that his company will likely hold a job fair this spring. He added that while Dave & Buster's is in "a similar category," he said the competitor's decision to also open a location in Daytona Beach, is "nothing that we're worried about." One Daytona is an entertainment/shopping/dining complex across the street from Daytona International Speedway whose other tenants include the 12-screen Cobb Daytona Luxury Theatres movie theater, Bass Pro Shops, several restaurants including P.F. Chang's, several retail stores including Guitar Center, as well as a 105-room Fairfield Inn & Suites by Marriott. More restaurants and shops are expected to open in the coming months, as well as a 145-room Marriott Autograph Collection hotel called The Daytona, that is going up at Victory Circle. Abecassis said he has been visiting One Daytona at least once every other week to check on the progress of construction for his store. "I was there on Monday," he said, adding, "the original plan (for One Daytona) in terms of the tenants that will be next to us and the layout is exactly what they (ISC) said it would be. We're going to be one of the three big attractions, between the movie theater, Bass Pro and us." CONTACT US | gametime | gametime Skip to main content High Contrast Accessibility Feedback Menu Navigation Empty Sign In / Sign Up User Menu Cookie Manager Is it Secure? Tickets My Tickets Print e-Tickets Return Tickets Exchange Tickets My Gift Cards My Seasons Passes Orders Order History My Account Balance Help FAQ Buy A Ticket Receive A Ticket Join our Newsletter Returns Policy Privacy & Cookie Policy Term of Use Term of Purchase TICKETS CONTACT US REVIEWS DONATION STORE gametime TICKETS CONTACT US REVIEWS DONATION STORE CONTACT US CONTACT US Contact gametime: We really care about our customers and we will reply to every message ASAP. If you have any questions or concerns about buying tickets or your purchased tickets, please fill the form and click 'Send Email' to send us an email. Frequently Asked Questions Search: Search • How do I know if my order went through? After placing a successful order, you should receive a confirmation number and/or confirmation email. You can also log in to your account and check "User Menu > Order > Order History" . • How can I print my tickets? When you complete the purchase, assuming that you have selected e-tickets as delivery method : You'll see the tickets on the confirmation page and can print them right away In your confirmation email, there is a link to the "Print Tickets" You can log in to your account and print tickets from "User Menu > Tickets > Print Tickets" . • I checked out as a guest and didn't create an account. Can I still login to manage, print or refund my tickets? Yes, click on the sign in button, enter the email you used for the purchase and you can claim your account by confirming your email address. • My credit card show a charge but I never received my tickets? Credit card dashboards often show Authorizations as charges and that confuses buyers. Authorization is not a charge and will go away automatically in a few days. A failed authorization means that the transaction was failed for some reason.  If you tried purchasing, but never received a confirmation number or confirmation email but you see a charge, that is most likely a failed authorization and not a charge. Before trying to purchase again, check "User menu > Tickets > My Tickets" to make sure your purchase did not go through. If your order has not gone through, you should try purchasing again. Your purchase is only successful when you see the confirmation page. • Why does my credit card show more than one charge for a single purchase? Am I double-charged? 1- Check "User menu > Tickets > My Tickets" to make sure your purchase went through only once. If you've made more than one purchase, you may want to return the duplicates. 2- If you've submitted your transaction with a wrong billing address, the AVS (address verification system, used by credit card processors to prevent fraud) will reject your payment but put a temporary hold on the amount, also known as "authorization". The authorization is not a charge and will drop off your statement in a few days. Check your statement again in a few days to confirm that the amount is gone. • Do I need to print my e-tickets, or can I just show on my phone? Most events accept mobile tickets, but some don't. Unless clearly instructed otherwise in the event information or the delivery method choices, you should try to print your tickets. • Can I change my ticket delivery method? Contact us right away, and we may be able to change your delivery method. • Can I change my seat or performance if I got the wrong tickets? If the exchange policy of the event allows exchanges or upgrades, you can use "User Menu > Tickets > Exchange Tickets" to exchange, upgrade or change the date of your tickets. If the return policy of the event allows returns, you can use "User Menu > Tickets > Return Tickets" to return your tickets for store credit and purchase a new set of tickets. Your store credit will be applied on the checkout page.your purchase went through only once. If you've made more than one purchase, you may want to return the duplicates. Otherwise, you can contact us. We may be able to exchange the tickets for you. • What if I didn't receive a confirmation email or invoice? First, check your spam folder. If the email isn't there, you've probably entered an invalid email address or are using a system that blocks our emails. To view, print, or receive the confirmation and email as an invoice, use the "User menu > Orders > Order History" and click on the icon for the invoice. • How do I sign in if I forgot my password? If you've entered the correct email address, you can simply reset your password. Click on the Sign In button, click Forgot Password, and wait a few minutes. You'll receive the password recovery code in your email, and you can then change your password. • I cannot sign in and I haven't gotten any emails (welcome email, order confirmation, password recovery) from you. What should I do? You've probably signed up with a wrong email address or made a typo in your email address. Try to sign up again with the correct email address. • I purchased Refund Protection. How can I file a claim? Refund protection is offered through XCover, an independent, 3rd party company. All claims and refunds should be processed directly and solely through XCover. We are not in any way involved or responsible in the refund protection process. Should you need to file a claim, create an account on https://www.xcover.com/en/login with the same email address that you used to purchase the tickets and file your claim online. If you have any questions or concerns, contact XCover.com  directly as XCover, and not the website you purchased tickets from, is solely in charge of the claims and refund protection. All the information that you need to file a claim with XCover is included in your sales confirmation email and you can access them again from the 'Order History' menu.
